handNote.p: Main hand, leaning slightly left sometimes, e often unhorned, ð is rare, tail of g is often closed, r with short descender, dotted and undotted y, þæt-abbrev. with cross-stroke hooking downwards
Revising hand, very active; Ker's 'small uopward-sloping hand of s.xi 2' in brown ink; Herbst's Scribe C. Prefers horned e, insular g, tall ſ, and dotted ẏ.
Revising hand in darker ink that worked before the other main reviser in brown ink; Herbst's Scribe B. Writes Caroline a, e, and g.
